question: Can I use my card to make purchases before the physical card arrives in the mail?
expected_answer: Yes. The day after you order any card, you will receive an SMS with a secure link to your virtual card details. You can use these details for online purchases or add them to a digital wallet for use in physical businesses immediately.
model_answer: Yes, you can use your card to make purchases before the physical card arrives in the mail. According to the source header "Card Delivery and Activation Process" from the ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services, after you order a card, the card details are sent to your phone via SMS with a secure link to the virtual card details. You can use the digital (virtual) card for online purchases or by connecting it to a digital wallet for use at businesses, making the card useful for purchases even before the physical card arrives. However, it is not possible to withdraw cash using the digital card.

question: I noticed a spelling mistake on my new card and my last name is cut short. What should I do?
expected_answer: To fix a spelling error, send a request to a private banker with your name in English or a photo of your passport. Regarding the length, there is a 20-character limit, so longer names are automatically shortened.
model_answer:
If you noticed a spelling mistake on your new card, you should send a request to your private banker specifying your name in English, or alternatively attach a photo of your passport showing your name. The credit card company will then send you a new card with the correct details.

If your last name is cut short, it might be due to a maximum character limit of 20 characters on the card, in which case the last name will be shortened.

(Source: ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services > Ordering a card > Correcting Spelling mistakes on Received Cards, cards.md)

question: Can I deposit cash into my account at an ATM?
expected_answer: No, cash deposits are not currently possible at ONE ZERO Bank. You can, however, deposit checks or transfer funds from another bank account.
model_answer: No, you cannot deposit cash into your account at an ATM at this time. According to the section "Depositing cash" from the ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services (source: cards.md), cash deposits are still not possible to ONE ZERO Bank accounts. The bank is working on making cash deposits possible and will update customers once this service becomes available.

question: How much does it cost to replace a lost card?
expected_answer: For customers on the ZERO plan, a regular replacement costs 10 ILS, while immediate issuance costs 40 ILS. Customers on ONE or ONE PLUS plans are exempt from these fees.
model_answer:
/n/n your answer: /n/n

According to the section "Replacing a card" in the ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services (source: cards.md), the cost to replace a lost card depends on your subscription plan:

- For customers on the ZERO subscription plan: 10 ILS for a regular replacement order, or 40 ILS for immediate issuance.
- For customers on the ONE and ONE PLUS subscription plans: There is no fee for replacing a card as part of the expanded fee exemption subscription plan.

Source: Header 2: "Ordering a card", Header 3: "Replacing a card", source: cards.md

question: I'm traveling in five days. Does the bank provide travel insurance?
expected_answer: Yes, AIG provides travel insurance for five days to Israeli residents with an Israeli ID card aged 18-85. You can view the full terms through the Isracard link provided in the guide.
retrieved_context:
Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Traveling Abroad', 'Header 3': 'AIG Travel Insurance abroad', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: The insurance is on behalf of AIG for five days. The benefit is given to Israeli residents with an Israeli ID card, aged 18-85. You can [view the insurance terms](https://digital.isracard.co.il/Abroad/lobby/before/insuranceactivation2/).

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Traveling Abroad', 'Header 3': 'What do you need to know before traveling abroad?', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: A few important things you should know before traveling:  
* You should update the credit card company (Isracard) before your trip and let them know the destination country so that Isracard authorizes transactions abroad as well.
* Transaction confirmation messages are sent only via SMS to the mobile number registered with the credit card company. Therefore, it is advisable to update the credit card company with your current number before traveling.
* It is also recommended to remember the PIN code if you wish to withdraw funds.
* We also recommend reviewing your subscription plan before you travel as there are subscription plans that grant you benefits in foreign-currency transactions:
* In the ONE subscription plan and ONE PLUS subscription plan, no conversion fees will be charged for transactions made with the card.
* In ONE subscription plan and ONE PLUS subscription plan, only when withdrawing foreign currency abroad, a withdrawal fee of 2% of the withdrawal amount will be charged.
* On the ZERO subscription plan, a 2% commission is charged for foreign currency card transactions.
* On the ZERO subscription plan, a 3% fee will be charged for foreign currency ATM withdrawals, both in Israel and abroad.  
If you are on the ZERO subscription plan, you might want to consider upgrading to the ONE subscription plan through the [subscription plans page](https://app.tfd-bank.com/portfolio/settings/selectPlan) before you travel, to enjoy benefits abroad including foreign-currency transactions at with no exchange fees.

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Non-bank Cards (External Cards)', 'Header 3': 'Advantages of a bank card', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: Bank cards are free of charge. All customers are entitled to a variety of credit card benefits, including: free travel insurance, 1+1 benefits (for credit card holders, subject to card use), TOPCASH and more. For bank cards, ONE subscription plan and ONE PLUS subscription plan customers are exempt from currency conversion fees on purchases abroad with ONE ZERO Bank Cards. You can upgrade your subscription plan through the [subscription plans page](https://app.tfd-bank.com/portfolio/settings/selectPlan).

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Bank and Card Policies', 'Header 3': 'Card Policies', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: Transactions or cash withdrawals are typically deducted from the account within 3 business days on a debit card. Customers can contact a private banker if a transaction remains pending approval beyond the expected time frame or if there are display glitches affecting transaction status. The bank's policies and procedures ensure efficient handling of card-related processes and provide customer support channels for addressing issues or inquiries. Credit card transactions are usually processed within 48 hours. Charges can be viewed on the [cards page](https://app.tfd-bank.com/portfolio/cards).

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Bank and Card Policies', 'Header 3': 'Bank Policies', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: The bank operates in accordance with policies and credit considerations regarding balance verification, credit increases, and transaction processing. Customers can contact a private banker for assistance with specific card-related tasks, including checking transaction status, resolving errors, or seeking guidance on credit-related matters. The bank's products are for the customer's use only and for account security, it is recommended that only the account holder use the bank's products, thus your spouse cannot withdraw funds from your account even with your permission.
model_answer:
Yes, the bank provides free travel insurance for its customers. According to the section "Advantages of a bank card" (Source Header: 'Non-bank Cards (External Cards)'), all customers are entitled to a variety of credit card benefits, including free travel insurance.

Additionally, in the section "AIG Travel Insurance abroad" (Source Header: 'Traveling Abroad'), it specifies that the insurance is provided on behalf of AIG for five days and is available to Israeli residents with an Israeli ID card, aged 18-85.

So, as you are traveling in five days, you are eligible for free travel insurance from the bank for a five-day period, subject to the stated conditions.

question: Can I pick up my card in person instead of waiting for mail delivery?
expected_answer: Yes, you can pick up your card at Beit Oved 5, Tel Aviv, from Sunday to Thursday (08:00-18:00). You must schedule an appointment through a private banker and present a valid ID or driver's license.
model_answer: Yes, you can pick up your card in person instead of waiting for mail delivery. According to the source under "Request card self pick-up instead of delivery," you can pick up your card from the branch by presenting a valid ID or driver's license at Beit Oved 5, Tel Aviv. Pickup times are Sunday to Thursday, 08:00–18:00, by appointment. To schedule a pickup, you need to contact a private banker. (Source: Header 3: Request card self pick-up instead of delivery)

question: What happens if I tried to withdraw cash, didn't get the money, but was charged twice?
expected_answer: The ATM system performs an automatic count at the end of the business day and usually corrects discrepancies. If the charge isn't refunded after 3 business days, contact a private banker with the location and amount details.
model_answer:
If you tried to withdraw cash, didn't receive the money, but were charged twice, here's what happens according to the provided context:

- The ATM system performs an automatic count at the end of the business day. If there is a discrepancy (such as you not receiving the money), it should not charge your account. (Source: Header 3: Double charge by ATM)
- If three business days have passed and you are still charged (i.e., you see the deduction in your account and did not receive an automatic credit), you should notify a private banker for further assistance. Be sure to specify where the withdrawal was made and for what amount. (Source: Header 3: Double charge by ATM)
- For debit cards, sometimes double charges or unrecognized charges are temporary and may appear as "Non-Final Movements" or pending transactions. Wait up to 24 hours to see if the duplicate charge is removed. If the charge remains after 4-5 business days, contact the bank. (Source: Header 3: Double Charges and Unrecognized Charges in Debit Card)
- You can also dispute duplicate transactions by going to your card management page, selecting "Dispute Transactions," and choosing the relevant reason ("I was charged twice"). The credit card company will investigate and update you. (Source: Header 3: Duplicate and unrecognized transactions)

In summary: Wait up to three business days to see if the duplicate charge is automatically refunded. If it is not, contact your private banker or use the dispute option in your card management page for further help.

question: How many cards can I have in a joint account?
expected_answer: In a joint account, each account holder can order one credit card (subject to approval) and one debit card.
retrieved_context:
Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Ordering a card', 'Header 3': 'Number of cards per customer and per bank account', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: In a single account, is it typically possible to issue by Isracard:
* One credit card
* One debit card  
In a joint account, only the account holder can request and receive a new card for their account, and each account holder may order:
* One credit card (subject to the bank's credit considerations)
* One debit card

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Bank and Card Policies', 'Header 3': 'Bank Policies', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: The bank operates in accordance with policies and credit considerations regarding balance verification, credit increases, and transaction processing. Customers can contact a private banker for assistance with specific card-related tasks, including checking transaction status, resolving errors, or seeking guidance on credit-related matters. The bank's products are for the customer's use only and for account security, it is recommended that only the account holder use the bank's products, thus your spouse cannot withdraw funds from your account even with your permission.

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Ordering a card', 'Header 3': 'Why you need to have a card', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: To complete the account-opening process, you need to order a card. As a digital bank without physical branches, the only way to access your money is with the card, which is issued as soon as you open the account. Each customer can order one card of any type: debit or credit (depending on the bank's approval). In order for your application to be examined, you must first approve your consent for a credit report. For each customer in each bank account, at least one card and at most one card of each type (credit card and debit card) can be issued. You can order new card on the [cards page](https://app.tfd-bank.com/portfolio/cards). Navigate to the Cards page, where you can manage your existing cards and order new ones. If you don't have a card linked to your account, ordering a new card is free of charge. However, if you are replacing an existing card, there might be a fee depending on your subscription plan. You can follow the prompts to select the type of card you need, whether it's a credit card or a debit card, and confirm the order.

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Card Security and Privacy', 'Header 3': 'Secure Payments', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: ONE ZERO bank cards are personal and cannot be transferred or used by anyone else, so you cannot let anyone use your card, including your account partner. It is not possible to add an authorized user to your personal card. The ONE ZERO credit cards and debit cards supports 3D Secure (3DS), an information security protocol used to securely execute online transactions. This standard ensures the highest level of security for all parties to the transaction: the payee, the card issuer, and the intermediary between them.

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Non-bank Cards (External Cards)', 'Header 3': 'Link non-bank credit card', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: You can issue a non-bank card from other credit card companies and link it to your account using an account billing authorization. To do this, you can contact the appropriate credit card company to order the card. You can associate bank and non-bank cards with your account here, whose charges will be deducted from the account. A card belonging to another bank, cannot be associated with an account here. However, it can be transferred and all card data copied to the account here of your choice. In addition, you can link non-bank cards to an account by setting a billing authorization, and then viewing an installation certificate for the authorization to the institution. We allow our customers to link their non-bank credit cards to the app to make it convenient and easy for them to view charges.  
You can link non-bank cards on their provider websites:  
* [Link Isracard cards](https://digital.isracard.co.il/personalarea/Login/?returnUrl=http%3A%2F%2Fdigital.isracard.co.il%2Fpersonalarea%2Fagreementmanagement%2F).
* [Link Max cards](https://www.max.co.il/login?ReturnURL=https:%2F%2Fwww.max.co.il%2Fagreements%2Fpersonal%2Fupdate-banks).
* [Link American Express cards](https://he.americanexpress.co.il/personalarea/login/?returnUrl=http%3A%2F%2Fhe.americanexpress.co.il%2Fpersonalarea%2Fagreementmanagement%2F).
* [Link Cal cards](https://www.cal-online.co.il/about/legal-reports/open-banking/).  
I also recommend you to share your non-bank card information to ONE ZERO bank account through the open banking service and view the total charges you have on non-bank cards with all credit card companies through ["my capital" page](https://app.tfd-bank.com/portfolio/settings/obi-as-tpp).
model_answer:
Based on the context provided from the section "Number of cards per customer and per bank account" in the ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services (source: cards.md):

In a joint account, each account holder may order:

- One credit card (subject to the bank's credit considerations)
- One debit card

This means that for each account holder in a joint account, it is possible to have at most one credit card and one debit card per person. Therefore, the total number of cards in a joint account depends on the number of account holders, with each holder being eligible for up to two cards (one of each type).

question: What is the process for receiving and activating a card sent by mail?
expected_answer: Cards are sent via 'Quick to Mailbox' (Israel Post) and typically arrive within 7 business days. You will receive an SMS when it arrives. Once collected, you can activate it via the bank's app or Isracard's website.
model_answer:
Sure! Here is the process for receiving and activating a card sent by mail, based on information from the provided context:

**Receiving the Card:**
- The card is sent directly to your mailbox via a service called Quick to Mailbox, in partnership with Israel Post, according to your updated mailing address in the bank's systems. (Source: 'Card shipping companies and delivery time and identification')
- The card is typically sent within 7 business days.
- You will receive an SMS notifying you that the card has arrived and is waiting in your mailbox.
- You need to collect the card from your mailbox before you can activate it.

**Activating the Card:**
- Once you have received the card, you need to activate it through the bank's application or with Isracard, at your choice. (Source: 'Card Delivery and Activation Process')
- Activation can be done:
  - In the app through the [cards page](https://app.tfd-bank.com/portfolio/cards)
  - On the [Isracard website](https://digital.isracard.co.il/products-services/card-activation/)
  - By calling 036364432, if you received your credit card in the mail or from the bank's office.
- Debit cards are activated the next day, while credit cards can be used within 24 hours of activation.
- A text message will be sent to you once the credit card company activates your card.
- When your card approaches expiration, a new card will be sent automatically, and you should activate it as soon as you receive it to ensure uninterrupted usage. (Source: 'Card Expiration and Activation')

If you encounter any issues, you can contact Isracard's customer support for assistance.

**Sources:**  
- 'Card shipping companies and delivery time and identification'  
- 'Card Delivery and Activation Process'  
- 'Card Expiration and Activation'  
From: ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services (cards.md)

question: Can I use a digital card to withdraw cash from an ATM?
expected_answer: No, it is not possible to withdraw money using a digital card; you must have the physical card to perform ATM withdrawals.
retrieved_context:
Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Card Delivery and Activation Process', 'Header 3': 'Activating New Cards, Card Activation, Virtual Card', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: For each order of any type of card, the card details are sent the next day by SMS to your phone number by the credit card company with a secure link to the virtual card details for digital use until the physical arrival of the card. The digital card can be used in businesses by connecting to a digital wallet or in online purchases, making the card useful for purchases even before the card physically arrives. It is not possible to withdraw money using a digital card
will need to activate the card in the app through the [cards page](https://app.tfd-bank.com/portfolio/cards) Or in [isracard website](https://digital.isracard.co.il/products-services/card-activation/). If you received your credit card in the mail or from your bank's office, you can also activate it by calling 036364432. Debit cards are activated on the next day. The card can be used within 24 hours of activation. A text message will be sent to you as soon as the credit card company activates it.

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Cash Withdrawals', 'Header 3': 'Cash withdrawal fees from ATMs in Israel using ONE ZERO credit card or debit card', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: Cash withdrawal from an ATM belonging to any bank in Israel is free of withdrawal fees. Private ATMs companies charge their own fees, therefore, we recommend that you withdraw cash from bank-run ATMs connected to a branch in order to avoid these fees. It is not possible to withdraw money without a card. If you withdrew cash from an ATM with operating or third-party fees, then the fee is from the ATM operator, not ONE ZERO bank.

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Cash Withdrawals', 'Header 3': 'Handling Cash Withdrawal Failures', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: Handling failures in ATM withdrawals differs between ATMs in Israel and those abroad:
* Failures in withdrawals from ATMs in Israel – If you attempted to withdraw cash from an ATM in Israel and no cash was dispensed, but you still see a charge on your account, it is generally recommended to wait three business days for the funds to be credited back. If, after three business days, you have not received a refund, you can contact a [private banker](/actions/attach_agent) for further assistance. Please specify the ATM location and the withdrawal amount. If you used a debit card, the withdrawal may not be finalized and could appear as a pending transaction. In this case, you should wait 24 hours to ensure that the pending charge is removed.
* Failures in withdrawals from ATMs abroad – If you attempted to withdraw cash from an ATM abroad and the transaction failed, please contact [Isracard's customer service](https://digital.isracard.co.il/Abroad/lobby/Abroad/CustomerService/) for assistance.

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Cash Withdrawals', 'Header 3': 'Cash Withdrawals limit using ONE ZERO Debit Card', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: The daily limit for cash withdrawal from ATM with ONE ZERO bank's Debit Card is different between withdrawals abroad and withdrawals inside Israel's borders:
* Withdrawal from ATM inside Israel borders with Debit Card - You can make purchases of up to 3,000 ILS per single transaction and to withdraws up to 5,000 ILS per day from any ATM inside Israel borders. For purchases exceeding 3,000 ILS on the debit card, therefore you will have to ask the merchant to split the bill into two payments.
* Withdrawal from ATM abroad with a Debit Card - You can withdraw up to 3,000 ILS per day from ATMs abroad, as long as there is remaining balance in your account.

Source: {'Header 1': 'ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services', 'Header 2': 'Cash Withdrawals', 'Header 3': 'Cash Withdrawals limit using ONE ZERO Credit Card', 'source': 'cards.md'}
Content: The daily limit for cash withdrawal from ATM with ONE ZERO bank's Credit Card is different between withdrawals abroad and withdrawals inside Israel's borders:
* Withdrawal from ATM inside Israel borders with Credit Card - With your ONE ZERO bank credit card, you can withdraw cash up to 10,000 ILS per day from any ATM inside Israel borders. If you can not withdraw all 10,000 ILS at once, you can probably do it in two strokes. The daily withdrawal limit in one stroke on your credit card is 8,000 ILS. However, there is a fee for withdrawals from a private ATM that will be charged to the ATM company. We recommend that you withdraw cash from bank-run ATMs connected to a branch. Notice that there is no cash withdrawal without the bank card.
* Withdrawal from ATM abroad with a Credit Card - With your ONE ZERO bank credit card, your cash withdrawal limitation from ATM abroad is based on your credit card's lines of credit. As long as your credit card's lines of credit isn't completed, you can keep use it to withdraw cash from ATMs abroad.
model_answer: No, you cannot use a digital card to withdraw cash from an ATM. According to the section "Card Delivery and Activation Process" and "Cash Withdrawals" from the ONE ZERO Bank Guide on Card Usage and Services (source: cards.md), it is not possible to withdraw money using a digital card, and cash withdrawal from an ATM requires the physical card.
